"Rating" widget
The
Rating widget
is an interface tool that allows the user to conduct online voting to receive feedback. The widget accumulates the ratings of other users and contains a form for collecting reviews.
Example of a customized widget:
Setup
Before setting up the widget, create a new
entity
and proceed to creating instances for this object type.
The widget is added to the object profile in the
instance visual
editing mode. When switching to the "Widgets" tab in the "Elements" panel, it is necessary to drag (Drag&Drop) the "Rating" widget from the "Interactions" section to the workspace.
Settings
To further configure the widget, click
, which opens a modal window.
In order to set up the widget:
Select a template or create a new one with widget display settings.
To create the template with display settings, click
and fill in the following settings in the modal window that opens:
Setting
Purpose
Name
Entering the name of the template.
Allow to leave reviews
Choosing the option to leave reviews. If the setting is active, the corresponding button will be available during the rating, when clicked, it will be possible to leave the review.
Example
The parameter is active by default.
Allow to respond to reviews
Choosing the option to respond to reviews. If the setting is active, a response button will be available next to the review
.
Example
The parameter is available when the "Allow to leave reviews" option is active.
Allow to leave reactions on reviews
Choosing the option to leave reactions to reviews. If the setting is active, the corresponding
and
buttons will become available next to the review.
Example
The parameter is available when the "Allow to leave reviews" option is active.
Add advantages and disadvantages to the review
Choosing the ability to add advantages and disadvantages to the review. If the setting is active, the review will consist of three fields: "Advantages", "Disadvantages" and "Comment", while all fields are required.
Example
The parameter is available when the "Allow to leave reviews" option is active.
Show reviews
Choosing whether other users' reviews can be displayed. If the setting is active, the review history will be available with the option to sort it.
Example
The setting is available when the "Allow to leave reviews" option is active.
Show details
Choosing the option for details If the setting is active, an area with statistics on the scores will be displayed..
Example
The parameter is active by default.
Text asking to give a rating
Entering the text of the hint, which will be located in the area to the left of the picker to give the score.
Example
Number of decimal places for the score
Determining the number of decimal places when calculating the average score.
By default, the value is "1".
Rating below which a review is required
Choosing the lowest score that does not require a review. If the rating is below the specified value, a mandatory field for entering a review will be displayed.
Example
By default, the value is "3".
The parameter is available when the "Allow to leave reviews" option is active.
Select the created template or create the new template with scores.
The template is created by clicking
which opens a modal window where the name of the template is specified.
Then adjust the score titles. To create a score title, click
and fill in the name, as well as the number of scores.
The maximum score (number of points) is 10.
The number of given scores determines the number of
characters in the picker. The specified headers are used for clarity when displaying details.
After saving the widget settings, the generated rating template will be displayed on the screen. The score set using the picker will be automatically saved in the System.
In the customized rating widget, the rating details are displayed in descending order of rating score (number of points).
As a result, users with "Write"
permissions
to instances of the object type in which the "Rating" widget is configured can give feedback by leaving reviews, scores and feedback.

on the review:
Example of the parameters:
Rating multiple items in one object profile
In the widget settings, it is impossible to determine the object for which the rating is performed.
If rating is required for different elements in the same profile, then separate templates with settings and scores for each element can be used.
Thus, it will be possible to leave different scores and reviews for each element separately.
